plot: A good version of Lex Luthor from a parallel Earth comes to the Justice League's dimension for help to fight their evil counterparts.

m.role: Badass Grandpa: Uncle Super appears to be the strongest of Superwoman's Made Men, as he takes the most effort to take down for the expanded League.
Battle Butler: Evil Jimmy Olsen. Ultraman's Pal, doorman, chauffeur, etc.
Beard of Evil: Captain Super, aka Evil Captain Marvel.

Papa Wolf: Yeah, that's right Ultraman, send an assassin to kill President Slade's daughter, it is not like he will not hold anything against you and arrive at your headquarters driving a tank with marines and nuclear weapons. Oh, he will? Oops.

f.role: Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths features Mary Marvel's Evil Counterpart from an Alternate Universe, Superwoman, who is shown with a muscular yet curvaceous build. Between this, her outfit, the dominatrix-like attitude, her unrepentant insanity, UST-oozing scenes with Batman, the Designated Girl Fight with Wonder Woman, and the voice of Gina Torres (well-known for playing two other warrior women), she's a bona-fide Amazonian Beauty.
Missing Mom: Rose Wilson appears to have grown up entirely with her father, as her mother was assassinated by Ultraman years ago.

In Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths, Rose Wilson gives off this vibe, though she's actually The President's Daughter. This is somewhat awkward for her father, since specifically she speaks out against his policy of appeasing the Crime Syndicate.
Statuesque Stunner: Wonder Woman, naturally, and Superwoman as well, especially since concept art shows her as even taller than Superman.
Statuesque Stunner: Wonder Woman, naturally, and Superwoman as well, especially since concept art shows her at roughly Superman's height.

Superwoman from Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths takes the BDSM subtext of the early Wonder Woman comics and turns it Up to Eleven. Just watch her beatdown on Batman. Also, the fact that it's been suggested she's more of the alternate universe version of Mary Marvel adds extra squick to her, since she may, in fact, be a young girl.

name: Crisis on Two Earths
